001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.DataOutput;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.OutputStream;
006import java.nio.charset.Charset;
007
008/**
009 * A low level abstraction and implementation detail analogous to {@link Appendable} and
010 * {@link DataOutput}.
011 *
012 * @author agentgt
013 * @param <E> the exception type that can happen on output
014 */
015public interface Output<E extends Exception> {
016
017        /**
018         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}.
019         * @param s unlike appendable always non null.
020         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
021         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
022         */
023        public void append(CharSequence s) throws E;
024
025        /**
026         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence, int, int)}.
027         * @param csq Unlike appendable never null.
028         * @param start start inclusive
029         * @param end end exclusive
030         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
031         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
032         */
033        public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws E;
034
035        /**
036         * Appends a character to an appendable.
037         * @param c character
038         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
039         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
040         */
041
042        public void append(char c) throws E;
043
044        /**
045         * Write a short by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}
046         * @param s short
047         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
048         */
049        default void append(short s) throws E {
050                append(String.valueOf(s));
051        }
052
053        /**
054         * Write a int by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}.
055         * <p>
056         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
057         * appendables that can write the native type.
058         * @param i int
059         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
060         */
061        default void append(int i) throws E {
062                append(String.valueOf(i));
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
067         * <p>
068         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
069         * appendables that can write the native type.
070         * @param l long
071         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
072         */
073        default void append(long l) throws E {
074                append(String.valueOf(l));
075        }
076
077        /**
078         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
079         * <p>
080         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
081         * appendables that can write the native type.
082         * @param d double
083         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
084         */
085        default void append(double d) throws E {
086                append(String.valueOf(d));
087        }
088
089        /**
090         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
091         * <p>
092         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
093         * appendables that can write the native type.
094         * @param b boolean
095         * @throws E if an error happens while writting to the appendable
096         */
097        default void append(boolean b) throws E {
098                append(String.valueOf(b));
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Adapts an {@link OutputStream} as an {@link Output}.
103         * @param a the OutputStream to be wrapped.
104         * @param charset the encoding to use
105         * @return outputstream output
106         */
107        public static EncodedOutput<IOException> of(OutputStream a, Charset charset) {
108                return new OutputStreamOutput(a, charset);
109        }
110
111        /**
112         * Adapts an {@link Appendable} as an {@link Output}.
113         * @param a the appendable to be wrapped.
114         * @return string based output
115         */
116        public static Output<IOException> of(Appendable a) {
117                return new AppendableOutput(a);
118        }
119
120        /**
121         * Adapts a {@link StringBuilder} as an {@link Output}.
122         * @param a the StringBuilder to be wrapped.
123         * @return string based output
124         */
125        public static StringOutput of(StringBuilder a) {
126                return new StringOutput(a);
127        }
128
129        /**
130         * A specialized Output designed for pre-encoded templates that have already encoded
131         * byte arrays to be used directly.
132         *
133         * @author agentgt
134         * @param <E> the exception type
135         */
136        public interface EncodedOutput<E extends Exception> extends Output<E> {
137
138                /**
139                 * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])}.
140                 * @param bytes already encoded bytes
141                 * @throws E if an error happens
142                 */
143                public void write(byte bytes[]) throws E;
144
145                /**
146                 * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[], int, int)}. Generated templates
147                 * usually do not call this method as great care as to be taken to preserve the
148                 * encoding. It is only provided in the case of future found optimizations.
149                 * @param bytes already encoded bytes
150                 * @param off offset
151                 * @param len length to copy
152                 * @throws E if an error happens
153                 */
154                public void write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len) throws E;
155
156                @Override
157                default void append(char c) throws E {
158                        write(("" + c).getBytes(charset()));
159                }
160
161                @Override
162                default void append(CharSequence csq) throws E {
163                        write(csq.toString().getBytes(charset()));
164                }
165
166                @Override
167                default void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws E {
168                        write(csq.subSequence(start, end).toString().getBytes(charset()));
169                }
170
171                /**
172                 * The charset that the encoded output <em>should</em> be.
173                 * @return expected charset
174                 */
175                Charset charset();
176
177                /**
178                 * Adapts an {@link OutputStream} as an {@link EncodedOutput}.
179                 * @param a the OutputStream to be wrapped.
180                 * @param charset the encoding to use
181                 * @return outputstream output
182                 */
183                public static EncodedOutput<IOException> of(OutputStream a, Charset charset) {
184                        return new OutputStreamOutput(a, charset);
185                }
186
187        }
188
189        /**
190         * String Builder based output.
191         *
192         * @author agentgt
193         *
194         */
195        public class StringOutput implements Output<RuntimeException> {
196
197                private final StringBuilder buffer;
198
199                /**
200                 * Create using supplied StringBuilder.
201                 * @param buffer never null.
202                 */
203                public StringOutput(StringBuilder buffer) {
204                        super();
205                        this.buffer = buffer;
206                }
207
208                @Override
209                public void append(CharSequence s) {
210                        buffer.append(s);
211                }
212
213                @Override
214                public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) {
215                        buffer.append(csq, start, end);
216
217                }
218
219                @Override
220                public void append(char c) {
221                        buffer.append(c);
222
223                }
224
225                @Override
226                public String toString() {
227                        return buffer.toString();
228                }
229
230                @Override
231                public void append(boolean b) throws RuntimeException {
232                        buffer.append(b);
233                }
234
235                @Override
236                public void append(double d) throws RuntimeException {
237                        buffer.append(d);
238                }
239
240                @Override
241                public void append(int i) throws RuntimeException {
242                        buffer.append(i);
243                }
244
245                @Override
246                public void append(long l) throws RuntimeException {
247                        buffer.append(l);
248                }
249
250                @Override
251                public void append(short s) throws RuntimeException {
252                        buffer.append(s);
253                }
254
255                /**
256                 * The buffer that has been wrapped.
257                 * @return the wrapped builder
258                 */
259                StringBuilder getBuffer() {
260                        return buffer;
261                }
262
263        }
264
265}
266
267class AppendableOutput implements Output<IOException> {
268
269        private final Appendable appendable;
270
271        public AppendableOutput(Appendable appendable) {
272                super();
273                this.appendable = appendable;
274        }
275
276        @Override
277        public void append(CharSequence s) throws IOException {
278                appendable.append(s);
279        }
280
281        @Override
282        public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
283                appendable.append(csq, start, end);
284
285        }
286
287        @Override
288        public void append(char c) throws IOException {
289                appendable.append(c);
290
291        }
292
293}
294
295class OutputStreamOutput implements Output.EncodedOutput<IOException> {
296
297        private final OutputStream outputStream;
298
299        private final Charset charset;
300
301        public OutputStreamOutput(OutputStream outputStream, Charset charset) {
302                super();
303                this.outputStream = outputStream;
304                this.charset = charset;
305        }
306
307        @Override
308        public void write(byte[] b) throws IOException {
309                outputStream.write(b);
310        }
311
312        @Override
313        public void write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len) throws IOException {
314                outputStream.write(bytes, off, len);
315        }
316
317        @Override
318        public void append(char c) throws IOException {
319                outputStream.write(("" + c).getBytes(this.charset));
320        }
321
322        @Override
323        public void append(CharSequence csq) throws IOException {
324                outputStream.write(csq.toString().getBytes(this.charset));
325        }
326
327        @Override
328        public void append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
329                outputStream.write(csq.subSequence(start, end).toString().getBytes(this.charset));
330        }
331
332        @Override
333        public Charset charset() {
334                return charset;
335        }
336
337}
